Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BTD-10 (BTD 10, Baboon theta-defensin-10; natural AMPs; primates, mammals, animals; 3S=S, XXC; UCBB1ab; Cys-rich; Arg-rich)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (88.9%) toBTD-2. Compared to BTD-2, only two hydrophobic residues V3 and V12 were replaced with F.Activity: Active against drug resistant C. albicans clinical isolates (MIC 3.1-12 ug/ml). Updated seq8/2022
Literature Information.Author: Basso V, Garcia A, Tran DQ, Schaal JB, Tran P, Ngole D, Aqeel Y, Tongaokai P, Quellette AJ, Selsted ME 2018.
Literature Information.Title: Fungicidal Potency and Mechanisms of theta-Defensins Against Multidrug-Resistant Candida Species
